title: 103_hr3490
content: The "Cooperative Agricultural Programs Extended Retirement Credit Act of 1993" allows for creditable service in certain qualified Federal-State cooperative programs for Civil Service Retirement System purposes. It aims to expedite the retirement of certain Federal Government employees and improve retirement opportunities at typical retirement ages. The "Cooperative Agricultural Programs Extended Retirement Credit Act of 1993" allows employees to receive credit for service performed before January 1, 1984, as part of Federal-State cooperative agricultural research programs. The curr_chunk discusses the research programs of State agricultural experiment stations, the Federal-State cooperative program of forestry research, and the Federal-State cooperative program of agricultural research. The curr_chunk discusses the Federal-State cooperative programs of agricultural research and extension work at the 1890 land-grant colleges and Tuskegee Institute, as well as the program authorized by the Act for cooperative agricultural extension work between agricultural colleges and the United States Department of Agriculture. The curr_chunk discusses Federal-State cooperative programs in vocational education, marketing service, and research authorized by various acts, including the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946. The curr_chunk discusses programs for inspecting agricultural products in interstate commerce and controlling plant pests and animal diseases authorized by various acts, including the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946. The curr_chunk discusses appropriations for war expenses and other purposes approved in various acts from different fiscal years, including the Department of Agriculture Organic Act of 1944 and the Joint resolution for controlling insect pests and plant diseases. The curr_chunk discusses the regulation of importation of nursery stock, plants, and plant products under various acts dating back to 1912. The curr_chunk mentions regulations regarding the importation of plants for scientific purposes under different acts, including the Plant-Quarantine Act and the Bureau of Animal Industry Act. It also refers to Federal-State cooperative programs for forest protection and management. The curr_chunk discusses the protection, management, and improvement of forest lands under various Acts, including the Act of 1924, the Cooperative Forest Management Act of 1950, and the Forest Pest Control Act of 1947. It also mentions Federal-State cooperative programs for emergency relief established under the Federal Emergency Relief Act of 1933. The Relief Act of 1933, along with additional appropriations for the civil works program and other purposes, were approved in 1934. The Federal-State Cooperative Veterans' educational programs, including on-the-farm training, were also established. The curr_chunk discusses training programs under the Serviceman's Readjustment Act of 1944 and Federal-State cooperative programs in wildlife and fish restoration authorized by the Pittman-Robertson Act and Dingell-Johnson Act. The Dingell-Johnson Act authorizes a program for animal damage control, including the eradication of predatory animals and the suppression of rabies and tularemia. The Office of Personnel Management will accept certification from the Secretary of Agriculture for services seeking credit under this Act. SEC. 4. APPLICABILITY TO ANNUITANTS. An annuity or survivor annuity computed based on service described in section 3 before the enactment of this Act shall be recomputed if application is made within 6 months. Any change resulting from the recomputation shall be effective as of the first day of the first month after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 5. DEFINITION. The term "State" in this Act includes the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the Virgin Islands, and the territories of Hawaii and Alaska before statehood.
